body:
Looks like it schedules a new job, so there's probably some difference in the keys being generated for redis between the two.

I assume that "Memory quota exceeded" is unrelated?

issue.title: Fix old style redis key in classify_bug

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
This also refactors all calls that store keys in redis to a 'setkey'
function. The main purpose being so we can log transactions at the debug
level, making it easier to investigate failures like this in the future.

Fixes #1365

body:
> I assume that "Memory quota exceeded" is unrelated?

Yep, that's fine for now, but we'll have to fix it somehow at some point if we want to use smaller dyno types (#1366 would probably be enough).

issue.title: Add a test for the HTTP service bug classification with missing bugs

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
A test for https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1365, to be added in https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/blob/master/http_service/tests/test_bug_classification.py.

The test should cover the case where the HTTP service requests some bugs to Bugzilla, and Bugzilla replies with a subset of the bugs (so we get in this code path: https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/pull/1367/files#diff-69bcb3f0fdd5bbb5db3d5268908409f1R99).
